{"step_by_step_thinking": "Iodine is an essential trace element in biological systems. It is critical to the proper functioning of the vertebrate endocrine system. The primary function of iodine is its role in the synthesis of thyroid hormones thyroxine (T4) and triiodothyronine (T3). Therefore, iodine is primarily important in the biochemical synthesis of thyroxine.", "answer_choice": "B. Thyroxine"}
